verses.kjv: The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.
verses.ct: A message of judgment against Damascus: Look, Damascus will no longer be a city — it will become nothing but a pile of ruins.

verses.kjv: The cities of Aroer are forsaken: they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
verses.ct: The towns of Aroer will be abandoned. They will become pastures where flocks rest undisturbed, with no one to chase them away.

verses.kjv: The fortress also shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria: they shall be as the glory of the children of Israel, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: Ephraim will lose its fortified defenses, and Damascus will lose its kingdom. The survivors of Syria will fade away just like the glory of Israel has faded, declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And in that day it shall come to pass, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall wax lean.
verses.ct: When that day comes, Jacob's glory will diminish, and his prosperous strength will waste away.

verses.kjv: And it shall be as when the harvestman gathereth the corn, and reapeth the ears with his arm; and it shall be as he that gathereth ears in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.ct: It will be like a field worker gathering grain, cutting the stalks with his arm — like someone collecting leftover grain in the valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: Yet gleaning grapes shall be left in it, as the shaking of an olive tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outmost fruitful branches thereof, saith the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: Still, a few will remain, like the stray grapes left after a harvest, or like shaking an olive tree and finding only 2 or 3 olives at the very top, or 4 or 5 on the outer branches, declares the Lord GOD of Israel.

verses.kjv: At that day shall a man look to his Maker, and his eyes shall have respect to the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: On that day, people will turn their attention to their Maker and direct their gaze to the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he shall not look to the altars, the work of his hands, neither shall respect that which his fingers have made, either the groves, or the images.
verses.ct: They will no longer turn to the altars they built with their own hands, and they will stop honoring what their fingers crafted — the sacred poles and the incense altars.

verses.kjv: In that day shall his strong cities be as a forsaken bough, and an uppermost branch, which they left because of the children of Israel: and there shall be desolation.
verses.ct: On that day, their fortified cities will be as deserted as the abandoned places that were left empty when the people of Israel came through. Everything will be desolate.

verses.kjv: Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, and hast not been mindful of the rock of thy strength, therefore shalt thou plant pleasant plants, and shalt set it with strange slips:
verses.ct: This is because you have forgotten the God who saves you and have ignored the Rock who is your strength. So you plant beautiful gardens and fill them with imported vines,

verses.kjv: In the day shalt thou make thy plant to grow, and in the morning shalt thou make thy seed to flourish: but the harvest shall be a heap in the day of grief and of desperate sorrow.
verses.ct: and on the day you plant them they sprout, and by morning your seeds are blooming — but the harvest will amount to nothing except a pile of grief and hopeless sorrow.

verses.kjv: Woe to the multitude of many people, which make a noise like the noise of the seas; and to the rushing of nations, that make a rushing like the rushing of mighty waters!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for the roaring crowds of many nations! They thunder like the crashing of the ocean. How terrible for the surging peoples who rush forward like the surge of powerful waters!

verses.kjv: The nations shall rush like the rushing of many waters: but God shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far off, and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.
verses.ct: The nations rush like the surge of mighty waters, but God will confront them and they will run far away — driven like chaff blown from the mountains by the wind, like tumbleweeds spinning before a storm.

verses.kjv: And behold at eveningtide trouble; and before the morning he is not. This is the portion of them that spoil us, and the lot of them that rob us.
verses.ct: At evening there is sudden terror, but before morning comes, the attackers are gone. This is what happens to those who plunder us — this is the fate of those who rob us.
